Package io.github.hotlava03.baclavaframework

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.hotlava03.baclavaframework.Command
  • public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    Must be extended if you use a dedicated class for a command. Required by CommandRegisterer.registerCommand(String name, Command command).
    See Also:
    CommandRegisterer

    • Method Detail

      • onCommand

        protected abstract java.lang.String onCommand​(CommandEvent e)
        Called whenever the command is executed.
        Parameters:
        e - The command event involved on the trigger.
        Returns:
        The message to reply to the user. May be null if nothing is to be sent.

      • getCategory

        public java.lang.String getCategory()
        Returns:
        The category.

      • setCategory

        protected Command setCategory​(java.lang.String category)
        Set the command's category. Useful for generated help commands. Must use for owner commands! For owner command usage, set category to "owner".
        Parameters:
        category - The category to set.
        Returns:
        The current command instance.

      • getAliases

        public java.lang.String[] getAliases()
        Returns:
        The aliases.

      • setAliases

        protected Command setAliases​(java.lang.String... aliases)
        Parameters:
        aliases - The command aliases.
        Returns:
        The current command object for chained calls.

      • getUsage

        public java.lang.String getUsage()
        Returns:
        The usage.

      • setUsage

        protected Command setUsage​(java.lang.String usage)
        Parameters:
        usage - The command syntax usage.
        Returns:
        The current command object for chained calls.

      • getExamples

        public java.lang.String getExamples()
        Returns:
        The examples.

      • setExamples

        protected Command setExamples​(java.lang.String examples)
        Parameters:
        examples - The command usage examples, formatted in text.
        Returns:
        The current command object for chained calls.

      • getFlags

        public java.lang.String[] getFlags()
        Returns:
        The flags.

      • setFlags

        protected Command setFlags​(java.lang.String... flags)
        Parameters:
        flags - All flags the command must support.
        Returns:
        The current command object for chained calls.

      • hasFlag

        protected boolean hasFlag​(java.lang.String name)
        Check if the command supports a flag on declaration. In order for this to work, the flag must be declared with setFlags(String... flags)
        Parameters:
        name - The flag name.
        Returns:
        True if this command has the flag, false if not.
